message:
Since these are I/O-bound and not CPU-bound methods, you should use async/await with Task.WhenAll. This will make them all run concurrently.

For more information, see "Async Composition" in my Async Intro post: [https://blog.stephencleary.com/2012/02/async-and-await.html](https://blog.stephencleary.com/2012/02/async-and-await.html)
